title: Baked Tilapia in Garlic and Olive Oil
summary: Baked Tilapian in Garlic and Olive Oil might be a good recipe to expand your main course recipe box. This caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe serves 4 and costs $2.28 per serving. One portion of this dish contains roughly 23g of protein, 12g of fat, and a total of 218 calories. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. If you have cayenne pepper, garlic, fillets tilapia, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. It is brought to you by Allrecipes. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 35 minutes. Overall, this recipe earns a pretty good spoonacular score of 74%. Try Baked Tilapian in Garlic and Olive Oil, Olive Oil Poached Chicken and Radishes with Citrus Pesto, and Baked Tilapia With Garlic and Lime for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Tilapia. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.

instructions: Rub the fish fillets with the crushed garlic, then place them in a shallow, non-reactive dish. Spoon the olive oil over the fish until they are coated.  Place the onion on top of the fish. Cover the fish and refrigerate overnight to allow the fish to soak in the marinade.                            Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).                            If baking the fish, transfer it to a 9x13 inch baking dish along with the olive oil, garlic, and onion. Sprinkle the fish with the cayenne or white pepper. If you are grilling the fish, wrap the fish and oil, garlic, onion, and pepper in aluminum foil.                            Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees F) for 30 minutes.                                                Kitchen-Friendly View

steps.step: Rub the fish fillets with the crushed garlic, then place them in a shallow, non-reactive dish. Spoon the olive oil over the fish until they are coated.
Place the onion on top of the fish. Cover the fish and refrigerate overnight to allow the fish to soak in the marinade.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
If baking the fish, transfer it to a 9x13 inch baking dish along with the olive oil, garlic, and onion.
Sprinkle the fish with the cayenne or white pepper. If you are grilling the fish, wrap the fish and oil, garlic, onion, and pepper in aluminum foil.
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees F) for 30 minutes.
